Hello Joe,

>
>
> > dogmatic attitudes like
> >
> > > The short version: No, you can't, and you shouldn't, because those are
> > 3
> > > different tests.
> >
> > do not convince me.
>
> It's not dogma; it's a summary of conclusions based on years of practice.
>
> > by the way: searching the archives shows pluralism on that question.
>
> ...and it shows the reasoning behind both sides. Certainly, I would want
> the original poster to see both sides and decide for himself.
>
> Please don't be so quick to judge. It doesn't help your credibility.
>

I have no mission and noone needs to beleave me.
What i want to express is:
"No you can't, and you shouldn't"
means: you cannot discuss about this.
I think: Of course you can. And the discussion shows people feel some need.
Would you agree so far?

"...becausee those are 3 different tests "
hm,... these ARE 3 different tests because you make them 3 different tests.
What i wanted to point out is:
this is a design decision.
And i had the impression you negate this.

hope i didn't hurt you.


greetings

Ernst
